On December 26th or 27th, police dispersed protesters demonstrating in support of Bobi Wine (who was prevented from performing a concert by the police on Dec 26th) in the Kamwokya suburb of Kampala.

On 25 Dec, a production manager assaulted a garment worker who was part of a demonstration demanding their outstanding wages and overtime for November inside the factory assumed at murmur area in Dhaka city.

In the morning of December 25th, doctors protested in front of Port Sudan hospital (Red Sea state), calling for President el-Bashir to stand down. The protesters were dispersed with tear gas by police forces.

actor1: Police Forces of Bosnia and Herzegovina (2018-)
notes: On December 25, 2018 in Banja Luka, Bosnia and Herzegovina citizens held a protest against the arrest of the leader of the "Justice for David" group, Davor Dragicevic, and several opposition leaders. The police intervened, dispersing the protest, and arresting several other people connected with the protests, as well as removing the memorabilia and a monument to the deceased young man from the square where protesters were meeting for months.

On Tuesday, December 25, 2018, Saint Peterburg police detained Shahnaz Shitik, an activist who was taking part in a protest meeting against the pensions reform in the local Yabloko headquarters. Shitik sustained several injuries during her detention by the police and needed medical attention. She was released two days later, having been charged with petty hooliganism.

On Dec. 25 2018, local residents, AutoMaidan activists and members of National Corps gathered near a World War II memorial in Odessa, Ukraine, and dismantled a construction fence there claiming it was erected illegally. On 24 December, local right wing organizations, led by local MLA Gujjar, staged a protest near a cremation ground in Sakalpura area of Loni (Ghaziabad, Uttar Pradesh) after four cow and calf carcasses were found there earlier in the morning. The group, which included gau rakshak vigilantes, protested against the police for allowing the cow slaughter. Police intervened in the protest to keep individuals from moving the carcasses to the main road.

On December 24, app cab drivers held a dharna outside the company office in Salt Lake city/Bidhannagar (North 24 Parganas, West Bengal), against a cut in incentives, stiff festive season targets, delayed payment of dues and suspension from the platform following passenger complaints. The police moved them away from the spot.
On December 24, in Chennai city (Chennai, TN), government school teachers staged a protest against their pay anomalies. Police detained some of the protestors.

On December 24, in Salem town (Salem, TN), members of the Land Owners and Residents' Welfare Association staged a demonstration and roadblock demanding the railway authorities to complete the underpass work in their area. Police intervened and removed several protestors.
On December 24th, demonstrations occurred in Babanusa in West Kordofan state as part of nation-wide protests. Five activists were arrested.

On or before December 24th students demonstrated in Kass (South Darfur). Police and RSF paramilitaries dispersed the demonstrators with tear gas and batons, making several arrests. The source describes authorities as using 'excessive force'.

On Dec 24, several Palestinians were tear gassed by Israeli forces at a sit-in in front of Ofer prison in solidarity with prominent Palestinian human rights activist Abdullah Abu Rahmeh who is a prisoner there.

On August 29, the former public workers who were dismissed by legislative decrees were dispersed by the Police forces when they tried to stage a protest on Yuksel Street of Ankara city. Five protesters were detained.

Anganwadi workers, led by CITU, staged a protest in Sangrur City, Punjab on March 26 against the Punjab Budget 2018. The City SHO Vinod Kumar allegedly misbehaved with some of the protesters.
All Adivasi Students' Association of Assam bandh supporters attempted to enforce a blockade in Gossaigaon, Kokrajhar, Assam, on 26 March, but were prevented by security forces.

1 person was injured when police baton charged a Ram Navami procession in Kandi town, Murshidabad, West Bengal, on 26 March. The procession was entered a police station after they were stopped from moving with arms.

Anganwadi Workers gathered in protest and blocked traffic on Residency Road with a march and sit-ins in Srinagar City on March 26 as part of an ongoing movement to demand a hike in their honorarium and the release of long-pending salaries. Authorities tried to intervene and one protester fainted.
The residents of Mendhar Tehsil, Poonch District, gathered in protest on March 26 and blocked the Mendhar-Jammu Road to demand district status. The police cleared the protest after a couple of hours.
The residents of Mendhar Tehsil, Poonch District, gathered in protest on March 26 and blocked the Mendhar-Jammu Road to demand district status. The police cleared the protest after a couple of hours.

On March 26, thousands of people gathered to protest against the corruption news related to the president Vladimir Putin upon the call of Alexey Navalny, the founder of the Progress Party. One of the protests took place in Moscow city in Moscow municipality, Moscow. Police forces intervened and detained some protesters, including Navalny.

On March 25, people took to the streets in Niamey to protest against new taxes, the protest deemed illegal by authorities was broken up by security forces who dispersed the crowd and carried out arrests, several civil society leaders were also arrested.

25 March. A group of people gathered at Dajirka-Dahsoon monument, Bondhere District to protest against Kenyan Government on decision to build a wall between the border of Kenya and Somalia. Police forces dispersed the crowd and reportedly arrested several people.

Human rights activists staged a protest in Kathmandu city, Central, on 25 March in favor of their demands which included the approval of the Roman Statute of the International Criminal Court. 34 activists were detained by the police.

Scores of temporary workers staged a protest in Karnal City, Haryana on March 25, demanding regularization of their services. They also tried to gherao the Chief Minister Camp Office, but the police foiled their attempt.

Thousands of teachers from across the state under the banner of Sanjha Adhyapak Morcha took out a massive protest in Ludhiana city, Punjab on March 25 in support of their various demands. The police used mild cane charge against some of the protesters who blocked the Jalandhar bypass.

On Mar 25, public sector teachers protested against payroll delays and cuts to their salaries in Erbil. The Iraqi Kurdish police and security forces have used tear gas and rubber bullets against the protesters, injuring several protesters.

assoc_actor_1: Viasna; BSDP-PA: Belarusian Social Democratic Party-People's Assembly; BCD: Belarusian Christian Democracy

A group of protesters intending to hold an anti-governmental protest was stopped from the entering the square. Approximately 62 people were arrested by police, including 5 observers of the human rights group Viasna. No casualties were reported Other protests were reported around the country.
SMSS staged a protest in Guwahati city, Assam, on 24 March against the government's decision to downgrade the Assam Women University to an technical institute. Protesters were arrested by the police.

IYC leaders and activists gathered in protest in Jammu City on March 25 to protest the BJP-led government and the police. Police interfered in order to remove an effigy of CM Thakur that was set to be burn. No reported injuries.

Hundreds of Anganwadi workers staged a protest as part of an ongoing strike at MA Stadium in Jammu City on March 22 against the state government's failure to meet their demands. Police forces tried to remove the protesters from where they were blocking a road; when the protesters refused, the police lathicharged the group and dragged some away, leaving some of the women injured.
Residents of Madina village took the body of a murder victim to Gohona (Sonipat, Haryana) and blocked a road. The police used a lathi charge to disperse the protesters.

assoc_actor_1: EDS: Together for Democracy and Sovereignty

Protests broke out in Arab Khuzestan Province on March 22 after a national TV program named all ethnicities in Iran except for Arabs. 150 protesters were arrested "in late March" in Khuzestan in connection to this event.
21 March. Students started demonstrating against the arrest of Oromo students at universities. Security forces responded by firing shots. No reports of injuries.

After an argument, the SDPO of Naushera slapped a young man; the young man attempted to self-immolate, but was stopped by bystanders.
On Mar. 21, 2018: Anti-auction demonstrators threw eggs at the police outside a notary's office in Athens. Police used shields and tear gas to disperse the demonstration.

Over 17-18 March, former and currently military officers protested against expulsion form their lands in Ivato.
On March 18th, a large group of people gathered in front of the the governor's office in Sarableh County (Ilam province) to protest law enforcement forces' failure in resolving local disputes.

On 18 March, dozens of workers protested in front of ENER national road maintenance company against the dismissal of 127 workers during a fusion with ATTM company. Police forces ended the protest through threatening to use force.

On March 18, the day of the Presidential Elections in Russia, several NRA activists protested near the Metro station Pionerskaya in St. Petersburg. Several activists were detained during the protest.

On 18 March 2018, a pro-Russian activist Kyrylo Stremousov came to a Kherson city council session along with a dozen his supporters and disrupted the first part of it by physically blocking the rostrum. A brawl between the officials and activists took place twice, which was broken down by the police. At the same time the police did not try to take the activists out of the session hall. Stremousov demanded that the city council session should consider three issues: the creation of a commission on tariffs, a review of public spending and a decrease in the threshold of tender procedures in Prozorro system.

On March 18, 2018 Unian reported that activists of "Movement of New Forces" organized a rally and later a protest near the President of Ukraine Petro Poroshenko' house in Kozyn. Protesters drove by cars from Independence Square in Kiev to the President's house in Kozyn. Near President's house protestors chanted "Resignation!", "Shame!". According to Unian on the way to Kozyn some of the protestors were stopped by the police and detained.
Over 17-18 March, former and currently military officers protested against expulsion form their lands in Ivato.
Residents of Naushera tehsil began a protest rally and march towards Jammu City on March 17 as part of an ongoing strike in demand for district status. They were stopped by police.
On 17 March, a group of over 70 people wielding pangas attached the Ishaka-Basajjabalaba Mosque protested in Bushenyi. The police arrested 3 protesters.

Israeli army fired teargas canisters at demonstrators in the nearby village of Ni'lin, causing many cases of suffocation by teargas inhalation.

Scores of employees of the Urban Local Bodies Department staged a protest at the Press Enclave in Srinagar City on March 15 to demand the removal of the incumbent director. Many of the protesters, including the president of the forum, were arrested.

On March 14, in Kotwali (Dhaka, Dhaka), students staged a demonstration against the quota system in government jobs. The police used batons and tear gas to stop the protest march, injuring at least 15 demonstrators.

On March 14, police lathi charged and used water against extension lecturers who tried to march towards the Chief Ministers residence in Panchkula city, Haryana. 5 were injured. They are protesting against deputation, recruitments and transfers.

On 12 and 13 March students across Togo took the streets and disturbed the regular teaching to protest the arrest of a German teacher in Kara on the 12th. In Kara on 13 March, students were dispersed with teargas.
On 13 March, gendarmerie used teargas at students who staged a protest to denounce a law that abolishes the promise of a direct post in the state sector after finishing studies.
On March 12th, members of the Sindh Lower Staff Association staged a protest rally outside the Karachi Press Club, but were dispersed by police when they attempted to march into the red zone.

Dozens of ultra-Orthodox demonstrators blocked a main artery near Tel Aviv on Monday, Israeli police said, in the latest protest against compulsory military service. Around 50 demonstrators cut off the north-south highway 4 in the predominantly ultra-Orthodox city of Bnei Brak. Police physically dragged away some of the protesters sitting on the road.
On March 12th, protests against the Turkish government's attacks on Afrin were organized in Tehran, Kamyaran, Sanandaj, Marivan, Maku and Boukan. 9 protesters were arrested.
On March 12th 2018, activists from the "14%" movement organized a demonstration in Moscow's triumphal square. Members were later detained by police.

On March 11th, PML-N activists gathered outside the Garhi Shahu police station in Gulberg, Lahore, to demand a man arrested for throwing a shoe at their leader during a seminar. However, police dispersed the crowd peacefully.

On March 10, in Nannur (Kurnool, AP), intermediate student protestors were injured when police lathi-charged them on Narayana Junior College boys hostel campus, after the students protested against the sub-standard food being served to them and ransacked the hostel mess.

On March 10th, around 250 people protested against the Romanian government at the Social-Democratic Party congress at Sala Palatului in central Bucharest. Three protesters were detained by the police and fined later.
On March 10th 2018, 100 demonstrators tried to block the entrance to the Alexinsky Karyer mine. Eight people were arrested during the demonstration.
On March 10th 2018, five activists were detained by police during the protest at Yadrovo waste dump in Volokolamsk
Police dispersed with teargas a demonstration of Senegalese opposition groups under the Initiative for Democratic Elections (IED).
Police on Friday fired teargas to break up an anti-government demonstration by political opposition IN Benin involving thousands of people.

On March 9, members of the Satkar Committee held a protest at the Dayalpura police station seeking action against the organisers of a "akhand path". The protest continued after the police booked 6 persons.
On March 9th 2018, around 100 protestors gathered in central Saint Petersburg in a rally in support of Nadiya Savchenko. 11 demonstrators were detained by Police.

On March 8th 2018, riot police violently dispersed a protest located at the entrance of the Yadrovo dump near Volokolamsk, Moscow Oblast. Eight arrests were reported and demonstrators report usage of batons by police.
On March 8, in Dhaka (Dhaka, Dhaka), BNP held a sit-in protest in front of the National Press Club in the capital. Police detained a JCD member and forced the protestors to leave the area.
A group of citizens organized a protest against sexual discrimination in front of the Ministry of Labour in the occasion March 8th. Security forces arrested 84 protesters.

BJP activists attempting to purify a desecrated statue in Kolkata, West Bengal were stopped by Police on 8 March. BJP activists began to protest and were then chased away by Police forces and TMC activists.

On March 8th 2018, several protestors blocked the entrance to the "Yadrovo" landfill in Volokomask. Demonstrators were then detained and forcefully taken by police, with one account of an elderly man being beaten with a baton.

On Mar 7, Trinamool Congress workers held a protest against GST on langar purchases of the Golden Temple in Amritsar (Punjab). They were evicted by the police.

On March 7, the Delhi Commission of Women chief led a march towards the Rime Ministers office in New Delhi to hand over letters supporting more action against the problem of rape. The march was stopped by the police. Allegedly protesters were manhandled by the police.

On March 7, in Thenkasi (Tirunelveli, TN), Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam cadre staged a demonstration in front of the BSNL Office at Thenkasi and burnt the effigy of Mr. Raja, and the police detained 35 protestors.

Students of the Bangali Hindu Astitwa Raksha Mancha staged a protest in Kolkata, West Bengal, on 7 March, against the desecration of the statue of the Jana Sangh founder. Demonstrating students were assaulted by activists of left-leaning student organizations.
In protest, students have stopped classes at the University of KwaZulu-Natal (UKZN), Pietermaritzburg campus. Police chased a group of protesters. Teargas was used to disperse the protesters.

In solidaration with the strike by CNAPESTE, students gathered to organise a protest march but were peacefully prevented by police shortly after meeting in front of the school.

On March 5, in Coimbatore (Coimbatore, TN), State Youth Wing Secretary of the Marumalarchi Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (MDMK) and two others were arrested for staging a dharna at the Collectorate demanding action against the alleged drug peddlers spreading across the district.

The Bahraini police engaged with the protesters using teargas and no casualties were reported.

The Bahraini police engaged with the protesters using teargas and no casualties were reported.

Thousands of people protested in Jerada against economic marginalisation after two young men died while digging in an abandoned coal mine. The demonstrators have adopted the slogans of the Al-Hirak al-Shaabi movement that staged a string of protests this year in the neighbouring Rif region. Security forces dispersed the protest.

Wearing black bands, he tried to block the road along with a few other protesters. Time precision 2 because a date was not given, but likely happened in the last 10 days from the date of the article.

On October 11th, members Youth National Conference were detained by police while they marched towards Lal Chowk in Srinagar city in protest against the recent braid cutting incidents in the state. Police forces broke up a demonstration of postgradute students, who protested against a prime ministerial decree that concerns employment. The protest took place outside of the Cabinet headquarters on Qasr al-Aini street. Police forces broke up the protest, after which, protesters then announced a sit-in. 'We are starting a sit-in, we are here not leaving,' they chanted.

Hundreds of people gathered together in several major cities including Ankara, Istanbul, Izmir, Adana and Amed (Diyarbakir) in memory of the ISIS attack that took place in Ankara in 2015, which resulted in the death of 102 civilians. The protests took place on Tuesday, 10 October 2017. In Ankara, the Turkish Police Forces attacked the protesters using tear gas and plastic bullets. No fatalities were reported but several civilians were injured.
Police used tear gas and water cannons to disperse anti-SAITM protesters in Colombo on 10 October 2017.
On 10 October, voters bocked roads to protest their names missing on the voters roll in Bong. Police restored calm.
Police disperse anti-IEBC protests in Saiya. No report of violence from demonstrators.
Anganwadi workers staged a protest in Guwahati on 9 October 2017 against the inaction of the state government in fulfilling their demands. Some protesters were detained by the police.

On October 8th, police used tear gas to disperse protesters in Anantnag town after they came out to protest police brutality in clashes on Oct 6th. In response to the same clashes, traders in the town had called a general strike on Oct 7th.

Protest action by people wearing Economic Freedom Fighters T-shirts, led to the closure of Shoprite's doors at the Greenacres shopping centre in Port Elizabeth. Police then had to use stun grenades to disperse the protestors.
Israeli forces Friday dispursed the weekly and peaceful anti-settlement demonstration in the village of Kufr Qaddoum.
Several Palestinians suffered from severe tear-gas inhalation on Friday after Israeli forces suppressed a protest in the village of Khirbet Qalqas.

JO staged a protest in Hambantota on 6 October 2017 against transferring the management of Mattala Airport and Hambantota Port to foreign firms. Police used tear gas and water cannons to disperse protesters.
On October 6th, police fired tear gas at protesters in Murran chowk, Pulwama town, after they gathered there to protest police inaction in curbing braid cutting incidents in the state.

On October 6th, the Joint Resistance Leadership led a protest march in Srinagar city from Press Enclave against the recent braid chopping incidents, and also as part of their anti-India protest program. However, police stopped the march from reaching Lal Chowk by sealing the Abi Guzar road.

A group of women protested the new law allowing muftis to marry couples in the Kizilay neighbourhood of the Ankara province's Cankaya district on Thursday, 5 October 2017. The Turkish Police Forces broke up the group using tear gas. No injuries or fatalities were reported.
On October 5, in Mumbai, police detained 17 people who took part in a silent protest at Marine Drive to mark one month since the killing of a prominent Kannada journalist.
Police dispersed a protest organized by a number of the dissolved Mauritanian Senate's members in the capital Nouakchott.

On October 5th, police fired tear gas to disperse protesters in Singhpora Pattan, who had gathered after unknown persons chopped off the braid of a local woman. Braid chopping incidents have been occurring all throughout the state, leading to panic and protests against police inaction.

On October 5th, police used tear gas and baton charges on, and arrested dozens of Aaaganwadi Workers and Helpers Union (AWHU) after they held a protest march from Lal Chowk to the Civil secretariat, Srinagar. They were protesting the government's alleged ignoring of their issues.

On October 5th, police used a baton charge to disperse protesters in the Baghat area of Srinagar after unknown persons chopped off the braid of a local woman. Braid chopping incidents have been occurring all throughout the state, leading to panic and protests against police inaction.

Students took to the streets to protest the killing of Mahamudo Amurane, mayor of the city who was shot in his house. Because some protesters burned tires, the police had to intervene, shooting rubber bullets to the air and using armored cars to disperse the crowd.
Opposition supporters went to the streets in Lome and in several city across the nation to ask for the return to 1992 constitution.

Police used stun grenades to disperse about 150 Cape Peninsula University of Technology (CPUT) students who were marching to Parliament to hand over a memorandum to the Department of Higher Education and Training yesterday.
Officers from the Tshwane Metro Police Department's VIP protection unit used pepper spray to force the group of about 100 student protesters.
KMSS staged a protest in Guwahati on 3 October 2017 against the BJP government. Some KMSS supporters were arrested by the police.

On October 4th, police baton charged and detained dozens of Batamaloo traders who were attempting to protest at Lal Chowk in Srinagar. They were going to protest against the moving of the Batamaloo bus terminal. No major injuries were reported.
Regime opposants went to the streets.

Nubians protested in front of the courthouse in Aswan against a judge's decision to extend the detention of relatives and friends who had been detained for protesting recently. Police Forces used teargas to disperse the protest and arrested seven of them.
Two Malawi Congress Party members were arrested after they led on marching in Nsanje singing campaign songs for the party.
Journalists staged a protest in Chennai on 2 October 2017 against the murder of journalists across the country. Some protesters were detained by the police.
The group of people impacted by the regional train project went to the street to protest the low indemnisations proposed in exchange of their parcels. Policemen dispersed the crowd.

An unspecified number of Bahraini Shiites took to the streets in the village of Aali, northern governorate, to mourn for the occasion of Ashura and commemorate Imam Hussein's martyrdom. The Bahraini police intervened and fired tear gas to disperse the protesters. No casualties were reported.

An unspecified number of Bahraini Shiites took to the streets outside the house of Sheikh Isa Qassim in the village of Ad Diraz, Central governorate, to mourn for the occasion of Ashura and commemorate Imam Hussein's martyrdom. The Bahraini police intervened and fired tear gas to disperse the protesters. No casualties were reported but several procession leaders were arrested.

Israeli forces suppressed a weekly march in the village of Kafr Qaddum in the northern occupiedWest Bankdistrict of Qalqiliya on Friday, firing rubber-coated steel bullets at Palestinian protesters.

Animal rights activists protesting the pre-Yom Kippur Jewish custom of swinging around a chicken were assaulted in the Israeli city of Hadera. Six activists were lightly wounded in the incident Thursday night, in which residents in Hadera began throwing stones and other objects at the protesters.
Protest by around 100 anti-corruption activists outside parliament. Police arrested a dozen.
24 people were arrested in Ankole and Teso sub regions for holding unlawful assemblies to protest the anti age limit bill.

Security operatives forced some legislators out of the Chambers as they refused to leave the room to protest their suspension after disagreements over the debate to lift the presidential age limit of 75 years.
Police in Masaka District arrested six members of Forum for Democratic Change (FDC), who staged a march to protest the impending removal of the presidential age limit from the Constitution.
People protested against the anti age bill in Mbale. Several arrested by police.
Anti age limi protests in Mukono. An unidentified police officer undressed the Municipal speaker as they tried to arrest her for participating in the protests.
Police dispersed a demonstration against the anti age bill in Kabale university.

A group of people gathered together to protest the current teaching curriculum in the Atakum district of the Samsun province on Monday, 25 September 2017. The Turkish Police Forces broke up the group. No injuries or fatalities were reported.

notes: Police broke up a sit-in outside the Minsitry of Foreign Affairs, arresting 27 Lucha activists.

Handicapped protestors blocked a Jerusalem-Tel Aviv highway on Monday. For the first time the police ticketed the protesters after an announcement the day before that the police's tolerant attitude to the protesters was a thing of the past.

A meeting between government officials and Ministers to discuss issues regarding the Central Expressway at the Nailiya Viharasthanaya turned into a protest with around 200 residents in Kurnegala on Sept 25. Officials and ministers had to be escorted out of the premises under police security. Those who participated in the discussion proceeded to march towards the Boyagane-Malpitiya junction and blocked the Kurunegala-Colombo main road in protest.
A protest was staged in Kathmandu on 25 September 2017 against the Medical Education Act. Police arrested 14 protesters.

Kamuli Municipality was on Monday rocked by gunfire for over three hours as police battled anti-age limit protesters led by opposition Democratic Party [DP] National Youth Chairman Moses Bigirwa. Police intervened to disperse anti-age limit protesters loyal to the Democratic Party (DP) in Kumuli.

Students protesting new academic rules surrounded the Vice Chancellor Prof. Celestine Obua's office. Some students however snuck through the neighboring regional referral hospital gates and poured onto the main road which forced police to unleash teargas.

At least 10 people were arrested after thousands of people uprooted from their homes by the Boko Haram insurgency protested in Dalori. The group was arrested after they ignored orders to disperse and return to their camps. The protesters were calling for better food, water and healthcare.

Hundreds of students and members of the SCoP demonstrated outside the Khartoum Court to protest the death sentence given to a university student for allegedly killing a policeman during protests last year. They later marched to the university of Khartoum. Police dispersed the protesters with teargas and arrested dozens.

On September 24, Netakimpuram, members of Desiya Murpokku Dravida Kazhagam staged a protest near Civil Aerodrome, demanding that the Government and authorities expedite construction of railway overbridge (RoB). The Singanallur police detained and removed around 70 party workers and cleared the road.
On September 23, in Kochi, activists of the Youth Congress (YC) and the Kerala Students Union took out a protest march to the residence of Transport Minister Thomas Chandy.
The Uttar Pradesh Police on September 23 lathicharged the Banaras Hindu University (BHU) students, who were protesting since three days against alleged molestation of a varsity girl.

On September 23rd, scores of Dogra community people gheroed state chief minister Nirmal Singh in Jammu and raised slogans against him and the state PDP-BJP coalition government. He was escorted away by police after being heckled by the protesters.

On September 23rd, police detained members of Batmaloo traders' coordination committee when they tried to march towards the CM's residence on Gupkar road, Srinigar, after holding demonstrations in Lal Chowk over the shifting of the Batmaloo bus stand.

Local people held a protest against toll collection at the toll plaza of the newly constructed cable-stayed bridge of National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) at Mandva village in Bharuch district on Friday. Congress workers wanted to reap political dividends from the protest and soon reached the toll plaza. Police detained 50 Congress workers from the toll plaza.
Police have fired bullets and tear gas to disperse students who have gone on strike demanding the immediate release of their colleagues who are currently detained at Wandageya Police Station.

Thousands of protesters in Togo Thursday joined demonstrations around the country for a second day against the rule of President Faure Gnassingbe, the scion of Africa's oldest political dynasty. The atmosphere was tense amid accusations of harsh repression by security forces on Wednesday, when at least 77 people were injured by rubber bullets in the far north of the country, according to the opposition.

On September 21, in Raipur, about 150 farmers were arrested during protest marches and sent to Raipur Central Jail after Section 144 of the IPC was imposed in five districts of Chhattisgarh to clamp down on a farmers'Ao protest march.
Police fired tear gas to disperse protestors and arrested oposition politicians who protested the age limit bill in Kampala.

Hundreds of students at the country's main Makerere University in Kampala waved branches and chanted "K'ogikwatako!" -- meaning "Don't dare touch it!" in the local Luganda language -- in reference to the constitutional clause on age limits. Armed officers -- including military police -- fired volleys of teargas forcing the students to flee to their residence halls and hostels.

notes: Police arrested 30 protesters demonstrating outside the Ministry of Foreign Affairs against the invalidation of semi-biometric passports.
Protest turned violent in Humansdorp as protesters were were singing and dancing peacefully when teargas and rubber bullets were unleashed on them.

Opposition parties in Togo kept on demonstrating over the rule of President Faure Gnassingbe, the scion of Africa's oldest political dynasty, amid accusations of harsh repression by the security forces. At least 77 people were injured in the town of Bafilo when security forces fired rubber bullets at the crowd on Wednesday, according to the opposition. Four people who were critically wounded were sent for treatment in Sokode, the country's second biggest city, about 50 kilometres (31 miles) to the south, it said. In statement, the opposition added that soldiers and militiamen in civilian dress "infiltrated demonstrations" in the northern cities of Bafilo, Kara, Mango, Sokode and Dapaong."In Dapaong, soldiers staged punitive operations all night," the coalition said. In Mango, the source said, a nine-year-old child was killed and 25 people were injured, including 10 by gunshot. The injuries were caused by hunting rifles and other guns -- types of weapons that the security forces did not use, the source said.

On 20/9/2017, hundreds of workers of HEPCO road construction equipment company and Azarab Industries Company staged two protests against several months of unpaid salaries in Arak city. The police used gas tear and batons to disperse the protesters.
People attempting to register to vote became restless with the delays, so the Riot Police were called to suppress the protests.
NASA protesters and police outside the Supreme Court were on Wednesday attacked by a swarm of bees and forced to flee amidst the issuing of the full ruling by Supreme Court Judges

Residents in Faluja neighbourhood peacefully demonstrated against Somaliland Army whom they accused of grabbing land adjacent to SLA headquarters that was given to residents by the local government. Somaliland police dispersed the demonstrators. There were no reports of arrests.

Dozens of residents of El Matmar, a locality just a few kilometers to the west of Relizane, protested in the city center to denounce the delayed initiation of criminal proceedings by police. It took the intervention of the local authorities to persuade the angry inhabitants to free the traffic that was interrupted for hours.

On September 18, the UT Police had to use water cannons to stop protesting BJYM workers from marching towards the Congress Bhawan at the Sector 34/35. The youths were protesting against derogatory and abusive statements made by Congress leaders Manish Tewari and Digvijay Singh on Twitter against Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
On September 18th, police detained dozens of Aanganwadi helpers and workers after they assembled at Pratap Park in Srinagar and staged demonstrations to protest the government's treatment of them.
Ugandan police have detained a lawmaker and 10 others who were arrested while protesting against a plan that they charge would enable the country's long-term president to rule for life.

On 17/9/2017, police used tear gas to disperse a protest by a group of university applicants outside Sanjesh Organization ( Organization for Educational Testing) against alleged malpractice or exam fraud.

Israeli forces fired tear gas canisters at demonstrators who were protestinga recent decision by the Israeli army to extend municipal services to Israeli settlers illegally residing in the Old City of Hebron.
Israeli forces shot tear gas at protesters at the entrance of Khirbet Qalqas south of Hebron city causing many to suffer from tear gas inhalation.

The Turkish Police Forces dispersed a group of protesters using tear gas in the Cankaya district of the Ankara province on Friday, 15 September 2017. The group was protesting in support of two teachers (Gulmen and Ozakca) who were on hunger strike to protest their dismissal by statutory decree.
Israeli forces suppressed a weekly march in Kafr Qaddum by shooting rubber bullets at protesters. Israeli forces also installed a military checkpoint at the entrance to the village.

On September 15, in Kottayam, nurses under the UNA took out a protest march from the district collectorate to Bharath Hospital, but they were stopped by the police near the Sreemahadevar temple, Thirunakkara. Police used force to remove the protestors.

On September 15, in Krishnagiri, police swooped down on the protesters led by the Joint Action Council of Tamil Nadu Teachers Organisations 'Ai Government Employees Organisation (JACTTO-GEO) here on Friday, bringing to an end their agitations. Over 800 teachers were arrested.
Police arrested demonstrators in Keroka town in Nyamira County. The demonstrators were protesting against President Kenyatta's verbal attacks against the judiciary.
Police in Lilongwe arrested a woman who was a part of the protests against gender based violence.
On 13/09 protests were held in Boreda and Karamille towns of Western Haraghe zone. One person was killed by security officers, reasons not known.
On September 13, in Thanjavur, the police took into custody more than 1,100 members of the JACTTO-GEO units hwhen they attempted to stage a stir to highlight their demands.

Food producers protesters took to the streets in Morondava. Police fired tear gas at the protesters after they blocked a road.
On September 12th, police resorted to a baton charge and used water cannons against teachers protesting against non-payment of their salaries since 2012 near the Karachi Press Club.

Social housing beneficiaries forcefully entered the local seat of the administrative region and then protested against social housing lists that were published the day before. Police in place could not prevent them from entering.

On September 12, in Salem, a total of 1,010 striking teachers and government employees, including 337 women, under the banner Joint Action Committee of Tamil Nadu Teachers Organisations and Government Employees Organisations (JACTTO-GEO), were rounded up by the city police when they organised picketing agitation in front of the Collectorate.
The Riot Police used teargas to disperse a crowd of 500 people who had gathered to witness the coronation of the Ndebele king.

Former senators tried to hold an improvised session in the former senate but were prevented and chased away by police forces. Reminder that the senate has been abolished by popular referendum around one month ago.

Dozens of construction workers protested at the company responsible for completing the health center project for not paying their wages. According to local sources, the Royal Gendarmerie prevented workers from completing their march towards the center of Tangier city.
Three women and a man were arrested for public violence after illegal structures were demolished in Thembalethu, George. Police officers had to use stun grenades to disperse them.
Police used stun grenades to disperse a group of protesting nursing students who were approaching the East London campus.
Israeli settlers attacked Monday the newly built Jeb al-Deeb elementary school, near Bethlehem in the West Bank, but were stopped by local Palestinians.
Police arrested ABSU protesters who were trying to enforce their bandh for Bodoland in Bijni on 11 September 2017.

Demanding that the state government should celebrate Telangana Liberation Day officially on September 17, the BJP staged a dharna at the Medchal district collectorate on Monday. Police took BJP floor leader Kishan Reddy, Uppal MLA NVSS Prabhakar, Medchal BJP president Madhavaram Kantha Rao and other leaders into custody and released them later.

At Nalgonda on Monday, police arrested BJP leaders, including Telangana State president Dr K Laxman, when they tried to barge into Collectorate's main gate as a part of state wide protest demanding official celebration of September 17 as Telangana Liberation Day.
ABSU protesters attempting to enforce their bandh for Bodoland were assaulted in Batabari on 11 September 2017.

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Students in Butembo held a protest. The police broke up the protesters by firing live bullets. Several people were injured.

Former senators tried to hold an improvised session in the former senate but were prevented and chased away by police forces. Reminder that the senate has been abolished by popular referendum around one month ago.
Police baton charged villagers in Ghamroj who were protesting the innocence of a man accused of murdering a student in Gurgaon. The incident occurred on 10 September 2017.
Indian National Congress staged a protest in Ranchi on 10 September 2017 against the deaths of several people caused by illicit liquor. Police detained protesters.
JVM staged a protest in Ranchi on 10 September 2017 against the deaths of several people caused by illicit liquor. Police detained protesters.
On September 9, in Hyderabad, activists held a protest to seek State legislature'Aos intervention. They held a protest where the GST Council met, and were taken into custody by the police.

notes: Students and professors in Butembo held a protest, which was broken up by the police. Several protesters were arrested and held in difficult conditions.
A pro-Bimal Gurung rally in support of Gorkhaland was held in Darjeeling on 8 September 2017. Police baton charged the protesters.
On September 7, in Mangalore, the police successfully prevented the Mangaluru Chalo motorcycle rally of the BJP youth wing.

In Mangaluru, several BJP leaders and party workers were detained by police on Thursday after they set out on "Mangaluru chalo" rally organized by the party's Yuva Morcha in protest against the alleged killings of Hindu activists in the coastal districts.

Shiksha Mitras protested outside the district collectorate office on September 8, with slogans raised against the Yogi Adityanath-led government, following which they moved to the main Surajpur road, blocking traffic. 200 were detained by the police.

On September 7th, police foiled the protest march of the Jammu and Kashmir Tourism Constructional Committee (JKTCC) and detained scores of its members after they tried to march towards the UN Office at Sonwar from TRC, Srinagar, against the killing of Rohingya Muslims in Myanmar.

All markets in Qardho were closed in protest to the increasing rate of Somali Shilling to the US dollar. Police conducted security operations where they detained 10 forex dealers. The forex dealers were taken to Qardho Police Station.
On September 6, shiksha mitras locked up the office of the basic shiksha adhikari in Bijnor. Police was called to disperse the crowd but the protesters did not budge.
Members of Samajwadi Chhatra Sabha, shouted slogans, made an attempt to hold a demonstration on the premises of a metro station in Lucknow. Police cane-charged the workers to disperse them.

On September 6, in Shivamogga, members and prominent leaders of the BJP were arrested by the police when they tried to take out a bike rally as part of ther 'AoMangaluru Chalo'Ao campaign organised by party'Aos Yuva Morcha.
On September 6th, police arrested several people after scores of KEA members assembled at Press Enclave Srinagar to stage demonstrations against killing of Rohingya Muslims in Myanmar.

On Tuesday, hundreds of BJP leaders and activists were taken into custody when they tried to take out bike rally - 'Mangaluru Challo' - defying ban order, to protest against the alleged 'political killings of pro-Hindu activists' across Karnataka; the BJP workers tried to take out motorcycle rallies in Bengaluru. BJP leaders and workers arrested in Bengaluru included former Deputy Chief Minister R Ashok, Lok Sabha member Shobha Karandlaje, BJP Karnataka Yuva Morcha President and MP Pratap Simha and former minister Aravinda Limbavani.

On 5/9/2017, a protest against the killing of two Kurdish Kolbar (goods smuggler) in the town of Baneh turned violent after police tried to disperse the protesters by tear gas and arrested a number of protesters. Meanwhile, the military prosecutor of Kurdistan province announced that five border guards were detained in connection with the shooting.

On September 4, in Bejjanki, condemning the attitude of TRS government in distributing land to ineligible persons, the all-party delegation staged rasta roko and dharna, obstructing traffic on Rajiv Rahadhari. The police swung into action, arrested them and shifted to police station.

On Sep 4, in Puducherry, about 150 students have been arrested when they resorted to a dharna at the AFT grounds in Puducherry without police permission. The students were agitating seeking justice for the death of Ariyalur girl Anitha and abolition of the National Eligibility and Entrance Test (NEET) late last night. The students snatched away the key of the police vehicle and ran from the spot.

The Kurdish Internal Security Forces 'Asayish' arrested 4 people in Al-Mabrouka camp in the western countryside of Ras Al Ain after the demonstrations which the camp witnessed by displaced people live there, demanding to improve their lives and increase the assistance provided to them. No fatalities were reported.
Police in Budaka District on Monday arrested three Members of Parliament who reportedly staged a demonstration over the sorry state of Mbale-Tirinyi-Nakalama road.

Anitha were arrested and released in different parts of the city. Cadres of the DMK, VCK and CPI(M) were also arrested for staging protests in different parts of the city.

On September 3, in Sankarankovil, as many as 37 cadre of Viduthalai Chiruthaigal Katchi (VCK) of Tirunelveli (north) district courted arrest for staging a road roko demanding justice for Anitha, a Dalit girl of Ariyalur, who committed suicide recently after failing to get a medical seat under the National Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET).

On September 3, in Tenkasi, twelve cadres of the Naam Thamilar Katchi were arrested for attempting to block a Madurai bound passenger train at Tenkasi railway station demanding justice for Anitha, a Dalit girl of Ariyalur, who committed suicide recently after failing to get a medical seat under the National Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET).

On September 3, in Tenkasi, 23 members of Tamil Puligal were arrested for staging a road roko near Tenkasi old bus stand, demanding justice for Anitha, a Dalit girl of Ariyalur, who committed suicide recently after failing to get a medical seat under the National Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET). Scores of Facebook friends along with the public staged an agitation near Tenkasi bus stand.
Dozens of Nubian activists were arrested Sunday in Aswan after rallying to demand their right to return to their lands.
36 Jean Ping supporters were arrested at a demonstration in Libreville.

Protests broke out across Coimbatore city on Saturday, condemning the Centre and State government on the National Eligibility and Entrance Test (NEET). A group of students staged a protest on the newly-constructed flyover at Gandhipuram following the suicide of Anitha, who led a campaign against NEET. Around 10.30am, members of Thanthai Periyar Dravidar Kazhagam, Dravidar Viduthalai Kazhagam and Dravidar Kazhagam attempted to conduct a rail roko at the Coimbatore Railway Junction. Police arrested 30 protesters.

Protests broke out across Coimbatore city on Saturday, condemning the Centre and State government on the National Eligibility and Entrance Test (NEET). A group of students staged a protest on the newly-constructed flyover at Gandhipuram following the suicide of Anitha, who led a campaign against NEET. Police held talks with them an allowed them to conduct the protest for 15 minutes. Later, police arrested 15 of them.
Protests erupted after Eid al Adha prayers against the extradition of ONLF official Qalbi Dagax. Five female organisers arrested by JSF Police. No reported violence from the protesters.

assoc_actor_1: CNFD: National Coordination of the Families of the Missing

Police Forces harrassed the protesters and arrested several in front of the CNDH residence. Protesters shouteed anti-police slogans.

Kadamay members staged a protest against the impending demolition of their houses in the Manggahan Floodway area in Pasig City, Manila on August 31. The police arrested 41 protesters. At least 30 people were hurt during the dispersal.
A Makerere University student is arrested following an anti-age limit protest during a presidential speech.

The police arrested the protestors. Time precision 2 because an exact date was not given.

On August 30, members of the Students' Federation of India (SFI) held a protest against the sexual harassment of a student in Shimla and tried to barge into the Shimla University's Vice Chancellors office, leading to a scuffle between cops and protesters.

On August 27th, Police resorted to a baton charge and fired tear gas to stop a rally which was marching towards the US Consulate in Karachi. The rally was organised by the Imamia Student Organisation (ISO) against recent remarks by US President Donald Trump.

Residents in Vugizo demonstrated in front of the police station to protest the intimidation and extortion of money by the police. Around a hundred demonstrators were arrested.
Supporters of opposition leader, Jean Ping, protested in Libreville to commemorate the anniversary of the disputed election. The police dispersed them.
Supporters of opposition leader, Jean Ping, protested in Port-Gentil to commemorate the anniversary of the disputed election. The police dispersed them.

Students staged a protest at Gate 2.5 of the Ateneo de Manila University in Quezon City, Manila on August 24 night, to denounce the extrajudicial killings in relation to the drug war and the death of a 17-year-old drug suspect. On August 21st, tobacco growers from across the district staged a sit-on Swabi-Jehangira Road in front of the Pakistan Tobacco Company purchasing centre in Fauijoonabad of Chota Lahor tehsil for two hours against the failure of the companies to purchase their products. They then marched to the Swabi interchange and blocked the road. Police were deployed to prevents an incident. Some small clashes occurred, but didn't result in any injuries.

On August 21, in Kozhikode, a march taken out to the collectorate by Muslim Students Federation (MSF) activists protesting against the latest revision of fee structure at private medical colleges ended up in a scuffle with the police.

On August 21st, a massive protest dharna was organized against the SHO Police Station Mendhar at Yadgar Chowk Mendhar. The locals accused that the officers brutally beat persons who were involved in the rescue operation of a trolley accident at Dhar khas.
Police dispersed with teargas protesters asking for the enforcement of the court's decision about the Boubess market issue.
Residents in Vugizo demonstrated in front of the police station to protest the intimidation and extortion of money by the police. Around a hundred demonstrators were arrested.

Congress workers stage a protest in Lucknow on 16 August 2017 against the government demanding the resignation of the chief minister. Some protesters were detained by the police.

Residents of a beach area in the Cesme district of the Izmir province protested the closure of the beach by a private company that rented the area on Tuesday, 15 August 2017. The Turkish Gendarmerie intervened by shooting into the sky. No injuries were reported.

Supporters of agitating Dr Govinda KC scuffled with security personnel when the former tried to enter into the prohibited zone outside Parliament Building in Baneshwor, Kathmandu. An unspecified number of Bahrainis took to the streets in the village of Ash Shakurah, northern governorate, to call for the country's right to self-determination on the eve of the anniversary of independence from Britain on 15 August 1971. An unspecified number of Bahrainis took to the streets in Sitrah island, Capital governorate, to call for the country's right to self-determination on the eve of the anniversary of independence from Britain on 15 August 1971. Police detained 11 members and office bearers of the Jammu Kashmir People's Alliance during a protest march in Srinagar, where they raised slogans against the alleged conspiracy to remove of Article 35.

In Buruburu area in Nairobi and in Kiambu on the outskirts of the capital, police lobbed teargas to disperse two rival groups, one celebrating Kenyatta's victory and the other protesting against his victory.

In Buruburu area in Nairobi and in Kiambu on the outskirts of the capital, police lobbed teargas to disperse two rival groups, one celebrating Kenyatta's victory and the other protesting against his victory.

Turkish police intervened and took into custody over a dozen protesters during a demonstration in the Kadikoy district of the Istanbul province on Friday, 11 August 2017. At least 2 protesters got injured.

People took to streets and staged protests as security forces launched a cordon and search operation in Al-Qaeda's Zakir Musa's village of Norpora, Tral tehsil.
Election protests occur in Kariobangi on a 11/08. Police involved. At least one death reported.
Police in Soroti district blocked a demonstration by a group of youths protesting the proposed amendment of Article 26 of the Constitution

Police arrested 109 farmers after they gheraoed the city police station in Faridkot on August 10. The farmers were protesting against the government for not adhering with their demands including complete waiver of their debts and implementation of Prof MS Swaminathan report.

The artisans in the Marmaris district of the Mugla province protested counterfeit product inspection by blocking the roads on Wednesday, 9 August 2017. The police forces arrived at the scene to peacefully resolve the issue.

The police canecharged the members of the Gaddi community on August 9, when they were protesting against the chief minister at Naddi village over his remarks against the community. Nine people were injured in the incident.

On August 9, in Warangal, a number of student activists were injured in a lathicharge by the police who stopped them from barging into the Warangal Urban Collector Office. Thousands of students from different educational institutions took out a rally from Ekasila Park to the Collectorate demanding that the State government release fee reimbursement amount due for a long time.
Protesters waged a sit-in in commemoration of deceased protester Imad Attabi. The sit-in was dispersed by Moroccan authorities.
Police dispersed youths in Kisumu who were protesting electoral fraud.

Demonstrations took place reportedly organised by minister Amongi and MPs Odonga Otto, Lucy Akello, Lucy Aciro and Olanya. Gunshots and tear gas were fired to disperse the protestors and MP Otto was taken into police custody.

A group of people in the Cankaya district of the Ankara province gathered to protest the ongoing detention and the 150th day of hunger strike of Nuriye Gulmen and Semig Ozakca on Saturday, 5 August 2017. Residents, who opposed the ruling of the Somali Military Court to execute a soldier for murder of the Minister of Public works and Reconstruction, protested after Friday prayers at Tarabunka, Hodan area. The demonstrators chanted slogans against the military court claiming that the ruling was unfair and demanded FGS to intervene. Police and NISA blocked the roads in the area. There were no reports of casualties.

The police used a water cannon to disperse members of the BJP Kisan Morcha on August 4. The protesters were on the way to gherao the residence of Chief Minister Capt Amarinder Singh for 'Aufailing to keep his pre-poll promise of full loan waiver'Au.

The last day of BJP president Amit Shah'Aos visit was marked by a demonstration by Congress workers at Mansarovar Park and started marching in a procession, carrying black flags. The protesters raised slogans and tried to push back the barricades, which was resisted by the policemen.

Two students were arrested during ongoing protest outside the Nelson R Mandela Medical School. Police reportedly started hitting students and two people were put into a van and taken to the police station. No serious injuries reported

In Shangla, police dispersed the protesting residents of Machkandai Puran by resorting to baton-charge during the blockade of a road. The people blocked the Machkandai Puran-Swat Road for around six hours to protest the delay in the construction of the Aloch Bazaar road.
In Ahmedabad, as many as 13 Congress workers, including some from its student wing, were booked by Ellis Bridge police of Ahmedabad on Saturday as they protested defection of six party MLAs .
Joutha Sangrami Mancha (JSM) protested and jostled with a police barricade while moving towards the Deputy Commissioner's office in Sivasagar.
Residents of Jhirbadi village, in Kurukshetra, blocked the National Highway-1 after a woman was run over by a Haryana Roadways bus and killed on July 28. Police cane charged the road to clear it.

Protesting farmers tried to block the Eastern Peripheral Expressway (EPE) construction site at Amarpur village in Greater Noida on July 28, demanding increased compensation from the state government for their land used for the construction of the Eastern Peripheral Expressway (EPE). The police arrested the protesting farmers.

Protesting farmers tried to block the Eastern Peripheral Expressway (EPE) construction site at Beel Akbarpur village in Greater Noida on July 28, demanding increased compensation from the state government for their land used for the construction of the Eastern Peripheral Expressway (EPE). The police arrested the protesting farmers.

Around 30 farmers blocked the Haldia-New Delhi Express train at the Bodaki railway station in Greater Noida on July 28, demanding increased compensation from the state government for their land used for the construction of the Eastern Peripheral Expressway (EPE). Farmers also tried to stop construction work at Bishada village and other places in greater Noida. The police arrested the protesting farmers from all places.

Police used tear gas to disperse protesters after the mysterious death of a teenage girl triggered protests in Ratnipora village of Pulwama district. Protesters alleged that she died after being molested by a bank employee.

A group in ODM t-shirts demonstrated along Oginga Odinga Street. They were then confronted by other ODM supporters who accused the protesters of sabotaging Odinga's election bid. The confronting ODM supportes then burnt the shirts. Kisumu Central ODM Chairman Seth Ochieng who led the group that scuttled the demonstration says as ODM they were not aware of the demonstration.

Students and volunteers of angleipak Students' Association tried to storm the Manipur State Assembly, Shimla, from three different directions demanding legislation to prevent non-indigenous people from contesting elections and casting votes. However, they were stopped by police.

Upset over the Supreme Court ruling which cancelled the appointment of 1.69 lakh shiksha mitras as assistant teachers in government junior schools, a large number of contractual teachers continued agitations across Uttar Pradesh on July 27. In Gorakhpur, cops cane charged to disperse the agitating shiksha mitras after they held up traffic. Around 50 people were injured in the incident.

Turkey's main Kurdish political movement, HDP, has called for street protests against government opposition in the Diyarbakir province on Tuesday, 1 August 2017, but faced police blockade on the first day of the initiative.

Striking Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) workers blocked the main entrance of the Ceylon Petroleum Storage Terminal in Kolonnawa on July 26, to protest against a Chinese project. Rioters, protected by the police, allegedly attacked the protesting labourers.
