Iranian newspapers say police dispersed dozens of protesters who were depositors of the Caspian Credit Institute, a government-backed low-interest-rate loan fund. They had gathered outside the country's central bank in Tehran, demanding their money back from the credit company.

MLAs of the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) and the Lok Insaaf Party (LIP) marched towards Chief Minister Capt Amarinder Singh'Aos residence, they were arrested by the police outside the Vidhan Sabha in Chandigarh on May 30.

Delhi BJP'Aos Yuva Morcha workers held a protest march from Mansingh Road to Akbar Road in New Delhi on May 30 and held a demonstration and burned effigies of Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi near AICC office, Congress headquarters. Police used water cannons to stop the protestors.
Police prevented demonstrators to carry out their sit-in in spirit of supporting the protests in Hoceima.

assoc_actor_1: LVDPG: Voice of the Gabonese People
notes: Members of LVDPG attempted to hold a demonstration against the Gabonese government. The demonstration was prevented by the police, who arrested 20 activists.

On 29/05/2017, a number of depositors of the Caspian Credit Institution protested the loss of their funds outside the Iranian Central Bank in Tehran, emphasizing they had trusted the Credit Institution since it was licensed by the Central Bank. The police used batons to disperse protesters. A number of depositors of the Arman Credit Institution also protested the loss of their funds outside the Iranian Central Bank in Tehran (reported on the same day). The police used batons to disperse protesters.

15 people blocked the tramway at Hay Mohmmadi in Casablanca, in protest of the new schedule for Ramadan.The actions this morning stopped traffic in both directions, meaning that trams were delayed for two hours and tens of thousands of commuters were affected. Police later removed the protesters, and trams resumed their service at 9am.

Cadres of Rastriya Janata Party Nepal staged a baton rally at Gaur of Rautahat to protest the second round of polls slated for June 14, which they claim have not been formed in proportion to the population. Police were deployed in the area to make sure the rally was peaceful.

Tension prevailed in Balakrishnan Nagar, Velachery (locality of Chennai) on Sunday after residents organised a protest along with Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) members against a Tasmac liquor outlet. Their march was stopped by the police before they arrived at the shop.
On 28/05/2017, a number of depositors of the Caspian Credit Institution protested the loss of their funds in Khorramabad. The police used batons to disperse protesters.
Students at UNZA held a demonstration to protest the eviction of unregistered students and the fact that grants have not been paid. The police broke up the protest.

assoc_actor_1: DISK: Confederation of Progressive Trade Unions of Turkey
notes: Five DISK members were detained during the protest taking place central Edirne in support of Gulmen and Ozakca who were dismissed from their services with legislative decrees.

Ten workers of the Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) along with the party's District West president were arrested on Sunday by the SITE-A police after they held a protest outside the K-Electric (K-E) office in SITE's Metroville area against loadshedding.

assoc_actor_1: PAIGC: African Party for the Independence of Guinea-Bissau and Cape Verde
notes: Police used tear gas to disperse a protest by around 2,000 people demanding that President Jose Mario Vaz resign.

The Karnal police on May 27 resorted to cane charge and use of water cannons to disperse Aam Aadmi Party workers who had gathered to protest against the "deteriorating law and order situation" in the state.

The police used water cannons to stop Uttar Pradesh Youth Congress workers who were on their way to 'gheraoing' the Vidhan Bhawan in Lucknow in protest against the Modi government's failure to keep the promises made to the people on May 27.
Madiga Dandora Horata Samiti members waved black flags and shouted slogans at Chief Minister Siddaramaiah in Kalaburagi (Gulbarga) on Saturday. Police forces gagged them and took them into custody
Residents of Adambakkam locality in Chennai staged a demonstration on Saturday against the relocation of a Tasmac store. Police forcibly removed them to a nearby marriage hall.

actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
notes: Several protesters were arrested at gunpoint in Sana'a following a rally of workers demanding unpaid salaries. No one was hurt.

In Dhaka, Bangladeshi law enforcers on Friday foiled a procession towards the Supreme Court (SC) in protest of removal of the statue of Lady Justice from the apex court premises. Police lobbed several tear gas canisters and used water cannons to disperse the protesters when they reached near High Court Mazar around noon. At least five people were injured while police took action on the protesters.
Hundreds Youth Congress activist held strong protest near BJP office at Kachi Chowni, Jammu city, while passing through various parts of city. Police were on hand to keep the situation under control.

Elements from the Army's 66th Infantry Battalion forcibly enter the camp of protesting banana plantation workers of Shin Sun Corp in Compostela Valley province, forcing them to lift their protest on May 26, two days after the declaration of Martial Law in Mindanao. The workers had been on a 2-month strike against the Korean-owned banana company for continued practice of labour contractualization and union busting. (recorded by the human rights group Karapatan)

On 26 May 2017, in Samraong City, Oddar Meanchey province, four activist monks were arrested after attending an opposition rally with police confiscating their mobile phones and deleting videos and photographs taken during the event, one monk said, though the account was disputed by authorities.
Police and Durban Metro Police were forced to use stun grenades to disperse protesting tow truck operators who blockaded the N2 Freeway to Umhlanga.

assoc_actor_1: PPRD: Peoples Party for Reconstruction and Democracy
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Supporters of the PPRD held a march to protest against a petition criticising the Governor of Kwilu. The march was dispersed when shots were fired.
Jamat-e-Islami members gathered to protest against K-Electric on Wednesday at Karachi's Shahra-e-Faisal.A contingent of police and an armored vehicle were in the area in case of incident.

Hundreds of police job aspirants from all over the state gathered in front of Vidhan Bhawan in Lucknow on May 24 to press their demands. Police resorted to cane charge to disperse the angry protesters, who were demanding their appointments pending since last year.

About 50 workers of the Communist Party of India (CPI) were arrested when they staged a sit-in protest at the office of the Director of Department of Fisheries and Fishermen Welfare on Wednesday against the delay in opening the Modern Hygienic Fish Market on the East Coast Road.

assoc_actor_1: JKNC: Jammu and Kashmir National Conference
notes: Women workers from the National Conference (NC) protested against the award of the Army Chief's commendation card to an officer who had tied a local to the front of a jeep. They began marching in Srinagar, but were soon stopped by the police.
Security forces stormed the sit-in of security workers at Tura Cement Company and arrested 22 workers and were taken to the police station.
Police intervened and detained number of people demonstrating in support of hunger striking academics in Besiktas/Istanbul.
Iranian security forces forcibly dispersed mass protests in the southern region of Ahwaz on Monday and Tuesday against what people say were electoral fraud in the recent municipal elections.
An alleged rape victim and two of her relatives were arrested for staging a dharna outside the residence of the senior superintendent of police (SSP) in Bulandshahr district on May 23.
A mob blocked the road in Silchar, demanding justice for a local murdered man. Police rushed to the spot to bring it under control.

CHP MPs joined the protest taking place in Ankara city center, to support Gulmen and Ozakca who went on hunger strike to be returned to their jobs. Police intervened the protest and detained 11 people.
Hundreds of people gathered on the spot near Jaman Shah where two women were killed in a traffic accident, and staged a protest against traffic police. Police later arrived to calm the crowd.
Police disperse El-Zakzaky IM protesters with tear gas and water cannons in Abuja. No reported violence from the protesters.
Iranian security forces forcibly dispersed mass protests in the southern region of Ahwaz on Monday and Tuesday against what people say were electoral fraud in the recent municipal elections.
Half a dozen PG protesting medical students sustained injuries when police resorted to a cane charge to disperse them near IAS Bhawan under Airport police station in Patna.

Nearly 300 cadres of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) on Monday courted arrest while staging a protest against the Congress government for its failure to provide jobs. Demonstrations were staged in front of government offices at Karaikal, Ariyankuppam and Villianur.

Nearly 300 cadres of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) on Monday courted arrest while staging a protest against the Congress government for its failure to provide jobs. Demonstrations were staged in front of government offices at Karaikal, Ariyankuppam and Villianur.

Nearly 300 cadres of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) on Monday courted arrest while staging a protest against the Congress government for its failure to provide jobs. Demonstrations were staged in front of government offices at Karaikal, Ariyankuppam and Villianur.
On May 22, 2017 about 30 protesters were halted by authorities in Phnom Penh as they attempted to march to the National Assembly to deliver a petition requesting intervention in a land dispute.

assoc_actor_1: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
notes: Police dispersed a precession by Movement for the Actualisation of the Sovereign State of Biafra (MASSOB) at Government Craft Centre bus stop on Aba road in Port Harcourt. No reported violence from the demonstrators.

Two of the protesting part-time teachers of Tribhuvan University were injured in police action after they entered the restricted area near the prime minister's residence in Baluwatar. Police used force to stop the protestors after around 175 of them tried to enter the prohibited zone.
Protests took place in Ouled Hadadj. The protesters intended to march towards Boumerdes to support the protesters there. Police prevented this by securing train stations and major roads.
Heavy police intervention and detention of academics on day 16 of the solidarity Hunger Strike in Istanbul's Kadikoy neighbourhood.

Supporters of Bodu Bala Sena (BBS) General Secretary Ven. Galagoda Atte Gnanasara Thera demonstrated against the police's attempt to arrest the monk at Thorayaya in Kurunegala on May 20 night. The police was forced to recede.
About 500 Indian National Congress picketers were arrested across Tripura as part of a bandh to press for a 12-point charter of demands.

On May 18, 2017, a group of protesters traveling to Phnom Penh to petition the prime minister over land disputes were halted along the road by authorities and were not able to continue on their protest.
Police intervention against Hunger Strike resistance in Ankara's Yuksel Avenue; 12 detained.
A sit-in took place in front of the ICRC in Sheikh Jarrah. Israeli forces reportedly assaulted protesters and detained three while suppressing the sit in.

All Traders Association and Auto Drivers Association of Thellar, women self help groups and Democratic Youth Federation of India (DYFI) joined in a protest against illicit selling of liquor in Thellar. 20 youth arrested then released.

The police on Wednesday arrested CPI central secretariat member K. Narayana and other leaders of the Left parties when they tried to enter the Anantapur Collectorate as part of their sit-in protest. Day 2

Farmers blocked the rail train on Wednesday asking for a water dispute resolution. Protesters lstaged a rail roko at the Papanasam station where they blocked Coimbatore-Mayiladuthurai Jan Shatabdi Express. The police arrested 25 persons.
Farmers blocked the rail train on Wednesday asking for a water dispute resolution. They blocked the Ernakulam-Karaikal Express at Thalavaipalayam and the police arrested 36 protesters.
A youth was injured after being allegedly beaten up by army jawans as he along with other youths protested during army recruitment rally at Akhnoor and raised anti national slogans.

About 30 people were arrested after they blocked Grayston Drive in Sandton during a protest. Police reportedly fired rubber bullets and stun grenades at employees of telecommunications equipment company Huawei
Unemployed alumni protested in front of the citizen's office in Jendouba. The security forces attacked them while they were waging a sit-in.

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Dozens of Tshibala supporters invaded the People's Palace before the investiture of the government. Police blocked the entrance to the hall for anyone wearing party regalia.

Residents in Igayaza Trading Centre in Birembo Sub-county, Kakumiro District protested against the proposed diversion of the road. Police from Kakumiro dispersed the few residents who had been incited by some local leaders.
Around 40 state Youth Congress were arrested in Bhubaneswar after they tried to break the police cordon and march towards the Assembly. They were demanding jobs for unemployed youths.

JBT teachers protesting on May 16 in Panchkula for their timely appointment blocked the gates of the Haryana Education Department stranding 1000 employees, following which the police cane charged the teachers and got the gates opened.

A group of lawyers and few other professions staged a protest on Anna Salai on Tuesday demanding withdrawal of the conviction imposed on Justice C.S. Karnan. 47 of them were arrested as the police intervened to stop the protest. They were bailed out later that day.
The police removed 356 cadre of the Communist Party of India (CPI), including 186 women, when they started a protest demonstration at the Nangavalli bus stand (Salem, TN) without police permission.
Protesters in Skhira tried to close the gas-taps in Skhira. Their advance was prevented by the army that is stationed there to protect them.

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Protesters took to the streets to demand the resignation of Abdalah Pene Mbaka, Governor of Ituri Province. The police fired teargas and live ammunition to disperse the protest.

A group of Palestinian youth closed the main street in the town of Huwwara following a sit-in to support Palestinian prisoners on hunger strike. The activists formed a human chain for almost a half an hour, until they were forcibly dispersed by Israeli forces.
A large number of traders assembled at the scene of an anti-encroachment operation in Islamabad to protest. Police arrived to keep the situation under control.

Candidates of the Haryana Teacher Eligibility Test (2013 batch passed) protested and marched from Panchkula to Haryana Chief Minister's residence in Chandigarh. The police cane charged the protestors and used water cannons to stop them.

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Activists in LUCHA organised a sit-in at the Mbuji Mayi Attorney General's office to demand the publication of the Election Calendar. 4 protesters were arrested. They were releassed on 19/5

On May 15, in Hyderabad, TJAC and its affiliates (CPI) perpetrated violence at Dharna Chowk near Indira Park against TRS counter-protesters. Home minister Nayani Narasimha Reddy, IT minister K.T. Rama Rao and TRS MLC Karne Prabhakar flayed the Opposition for the violence, alleging that the parties were trying their best to save their base.
North West police have confirmed seven women were arrested in Ikageleng near Zeerust during a protest over municipal services in the area.

A heavy contingent of police resorted to baton charge and shelling to disperse hundreds of Pak Sarzameen Party activists on Sunday as they tried to march towards the Chief Minister House, Karachi, after the negotiations between PSP and the ruling PPP party ended without consensus.

Police resorted to the use of force on May 14 to stop the farmers from holding protests demanding justice for farmer Jaswant Singh of Lehra Bega village in Bathinda who commited suicide. Villagers refuse to cremate the body till police arrest the people accused in abetting the suicide.

assoc_actor_1: NSUI: National Students' Union of India
notes: Police detained state president of National Students' Union of India (NSUI) Itish Kumar Pradhan and his supporters when they tried to barge into Naveen Niwas, Bhubaneswar. They were demanding a CBI probe into the death of an engineering student on May 6 last year.

On May 13, in New Delhi, Aam Aadmi Party MLA Sanjeev Jha was detained by Delhi Police along with 30 supporters on May 6 for trying to stage a hunger strike in front of the Civil Lines residence of suspended party member Kapil Mishra. After being released, Jha shifted base and is on a hunger strike at Jantar Mantar.

On May 13, 2017, around 250 activists gathered in Koh Kapi commune, Koh Sralao, Koh Kong, to highlight environmental issues. The group was barred from holding further protests by a local commune chief and by police.
Police in Masaka District stopped a planned rally in Nyendo-Masaka by Mukono Municipality MP and Masaka Municipality MP without using the usual tactics of firing teargas.
Three attorneys from CHD protesting for the hunger strike of Gulmen and Ozakca were dragged on the floor by the police and taken into custody in front of Izmir Governorship.

Three people were detained during the sit-ins in front of AKP Ankara Headquarters in Ankara city. The protesters were asking for solidarity with Gulmen and Ozakca as well as removal of legislative decrees.
Security forces in collaboration with the Khasadar and Levies force uprooted a protest camp in Jamrud and arrested at least 50 tribesmen who were protesting against acute water shortage.
54 persons were arrested after blocking a road to protest against the relocation of a liquor shop at the Mettupalayam truck terminal.
54 persons were arrested after organizing a road blockade on the Mettupalayam Road to protest against the relocation of a liquor shop
The police tried to remove two students, who were on hunger strike on the Markaz campus, but students protesting for the recognition of their diploma tried to block the police car.

University students from around the country protested against the employment policy of the Standard Gauge Railway construction in Voi on 12/05/2017. They blocked the Nairobi-Mombasa highway, accusing the China Roads and Bridges Company of employing foreigners, even though the President had ordered the company employ locals. Seven youth were arrested by the police, because of blocking the highway. No fatalities.

Palestinians participated in a prisoners solidarity march to Hawwara military checkpoint on the southern outskirts of the city of Nablus. The protesters, who carried Palestinian flags and pictures of prisoners, were pushed back by the soldiers when they arrived at the checkpoint.
In Chennai, students' Federation of India activists were Thursday taken into custody for staging a protest outside the regional office of CBSE against the National Entrance-cum-Eligibility Test,
Protesters went down the street to complain about the bad governance and the lack of electric power. Police used teargas to disperse the crowd.

Niger Delta ex-militants protest at the Niger Delta Development Commission, NDDC, office premises in Port Harcourt over provisions of their amnesty programme. Police broke up the demonstration with tear gas. Protest leaders claim they were attacked.
In a second day of protests in Kuyga (Port Elizabeth) outside the Department of Education offices, police used stun grenades and teargas to disperse protesters during mass protest action.

Residents of the Kannankurichi area staged a protest on Wednesday demanding immediate closure of a Tasmac shop functioning in violation of the Supreme Court'Aos order. Police forces intervened to stop the protest and brought the protesters to a marriage hall, from where they got released later on that day

Four Makerere University students have been arrested at Buganda Road Magistrate's Court where they had gone to attend the hearing of a case against Dr Stella Nyanzi who is charged with computer misuse. The students, donning the Makerere University gowns, said government should release Dr Nyanzi because they are missing her lectures. The students, whose details could not be readily established, were taken to Kampala Central Police Station.

A boda boda rider has died Tuesday morning after a collision with a KDF truck in Isiolo Town.There was tension as angry locals threatened to set a blaze the truck.They were also threatening to lynch the driver of the lorry.Police officers had to shoot in the air to disperse the crowd and allow them to collect the body of the boda boda rider.Two other people were seriously injured in the crash and were rushed to the Isiolo County Referral Hospital.

Several people were injured when police used a water canon to disperse a massive protest demonstration staged in Guwahati by the association of the Assam State Anganwadi Workers and Helpers, demanding a hike in their honorarium.

Relatives of the 14-year-old boy, Avinash Kumar who was murdered, gheraoed office of the Atam Nagar ACP, Rupinder Kaur on May 8, to protest exclusion of the name of the workshop owner, Sartaj Kaur, from the FIR. The police had to use mild lathicharge to disperse protesters.
Another protest by women against a Tasmac shop. Dispersed by the police.
Police detained Independent MLA Sheikh Abdul Rashid when he and his AIP supporters tried to take out a protest march in Srinigar as the civil secretariat reopened.

Youth Congress workers on May 7 staged a protest outside the residence of Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal over the corruption allegations leveled against the AAP supremo by sacked Delhi minister Kapil Mishra. The police used water cannons.

assoc_actor_1: UNAFEC: Union of Nationalist Federalists of Congo Party
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: The police and military prevented Gabriel Kyungu wa Kumwanza from holding a rally in Lubumbashi. They arrested some supporters, other supporters fled and took refuge in the MONUSCO office.

Demonstrations erupted in Eldoret after it emerged that Jubilee was planning to repeat the primaries at the station. Unknown people attacked three Governor Jackson Mandago's campaigners (Jubilee Party). No fatalities.
Israeli forces prevented Palestinians from performing Friday prayers for the third consecutive week in the village of Deir Istiya in the occupiedWest Bankdistrict of Salfit. No clashes erupted.
Villagers of Neckanamalai, a hill near Vaniyambadi, staged a waiting protest in front of the office of a Member of Legislative Assembly of Vaniyambad and were arrested.

Israeli forces suppressed a peaceful march organized by Palestinian journalists on World Press Freedom Day in front of Ofer prison in the central occupiedWest Bankdistrict of Ramallah on Wednesday. Israeli forces used tear gas to suppress protesters, and detained journalists.
Police foiled a postgraduate student's attempt to self-immolate in protest on Wednesday evening, during the ongoing protests at the Allahabad University campus.

A march taken out by the Students Federation of India (SFI) demanding a rollback of the suspension of seven of its members in the college was stopped by the police from entering the St.Albert'Aos College on Wednesday

Over 15 Makerere University students have been arrested for taking part in the demonstration that took place today morning at the main campus. Students went on strike protesting the failure by the university to release their results for the last semester, failure to issue Identity Cards to first year students and transcripts to graduates. The police fired teargas and rubber bullets to disperse students and by press time the situation was looking a bit calm.

Business in Kitgum town is back to normal following a protest by passengers at Kitgum Bus Park on Wednesday that led to police firing gunshots.The development came when Bus operators woke up and found the park under lock and key after the Kitgum Central Division officials maintained that no bus would be allowed to exit the park without paying a daily levy

A number of Haredim disturbed that service to honor fallen Haredi soldiers. After a few minutes, police arrived at the scene and pushed back the protesters to the other end of the cemetery, where they continued to shout.
Nearly 200 trade unionists were dispersed by the police from a May Day demonstration.

A group of Palestinians gathered at the Damascus Gate area outside the Old City and attempted to draw a mural depicting images of solidarity with the hunger strikers. Israeli forces raided the area, confiscated the banner and detained an activist.

On 1 May 2017, police intervened to stop more than 1,000 protesters from conducting a march to celebrate International Workers' Day in Phnom Penh. The workers, from different industries, were eventually allowed to proceed with a shorter march, with around 100 riot police standing by.

Families of detained activists staged a sit-in in front of the Tahar Djaou media headquarters in Algiers, calling for their liberation. The activists have been detained for 21 months in M'zab valley. Police intervened to disperse the protesters.

assoc_actor_1: IRA: Resurgence of the Abolitionist Movement
source: Radio France Internationale, Arab Trade Union
notes: The anti-slavery 'Initiative for the Resurgence of the Abolitionist Movement' organized a protest in the streets of Nouakchott to commemorate former slaves and protest against current forms of slavery. The police intervend and used teargas to dispere the protesters, entering into confrontation with some of them.

In the northern part of theWest Bankdistrict of Salfit, dozens of Palestinians performed Friday prayers in the village of Deir Istiya, near an agricultural area that had been closed off by Israeli forces, which has prevented Palestinian farmers from reaching their lands.
BJP staged a protest in Thiruvananthapuram on 28 April 2017 against encroachements. Police used water cannons to disperse the protesters.

The youths, carrying banners and placards against Sheikh Ibrahim Zakzaky and the Islamic Movement in Nigeria (IMN), gathered outside the Government House gate waiting for an address from the representatives of the Kaduna State Government. Anti-riot policemen came to the venue in trucks, firing tear gas. Several minor injuries reported. No reported violence from the protesters.
A group of protesters were blocked and 12 of them were detained by police forces, when they tried to disrupt the program of Ensar Foundation in Artvin city. No clashes or casualties were reported.

Parents gathered at the local Desh Bhagat Yadgaar Hall to take out a candlelight march to the residence of Jalandhar Central MLA Rajinder Beri in Jalandhar on Thursday, to protest school fee hike. They were stopped by the police at Namdev Chowk and were not able to meet Beri.

On 27 April 2017, a number of Gonabadi Dervishes gathered around the house of one of their companions which had been surrounded by a police after a gunshot was heard. The police left the area shortly after.

assoc_actor_2: CPI(M): Communist Party of India (Marxist); Police Forces of India (2014-)
notes: CPI(M) activists attempted to bring down the tent in which Pengal Otrumai leaders were protesting in Munnar on 27 April 2017. Police intervention was required to control the situation.
Police intervened to disperse protesters in Ghannouch on Thursday.

In Kisumu town, police used teargas canisters to disperse youths who were protesting the award of the ODM ticket to Kisumu central MP Ken Obura.The youths argued that Mr Obura had been rigged in at the expense of Gem Central MCA Fred Ouda. An entourage of boda boda riders led by Kisumu governor Jack Ranguma, who were protesting the win of senator Anyang' Nyong'o for the ODM governorship ticket, were caught in the melee.Hundreds of Mr Ouda's supporters thronged the streets chanting his slogans.

On April 26, 2017, protesters marked the fifth anniversary of an environmental activist's death in Phnom Penh by gathering for a brief prayer session. Security guards were deployed to the scene and pushed and pulled a few of the protesters.
On 26 April 2017, in Phnom Penh, district security guards briefly arrested eight women outside the World Bank headquarters during a peaceful demonstration for Phnom Penh's Boeung Kak community.
On 26-April-2017, in Mandalay, students from the Sagaing Teacher Training College were arrested while protesting the college'Aos rules in front of the Department of Higher Education.

Police fired shots in the air to quell chaos that erupted in Homa Bay following the declaration of incumbent Governor Cyprian Awiti winner in the Orange Democratic Movement nominations.Police were called in to contain the situation after supporters of his opponents vowed not to accept the result of the hotly contested nomination, in which he was facing off with Kasipul MP Oyugi Magwanga and businessman Sammy Wakiaga

assoc_actor_1: DMK: Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam; CPI(M): Communist Party of India (Marxist); CPI: Communist Party of India; Labour Group (India)
notes: Members of DMK, CPI(M), CPI and various trade unions staged protests in Madurai on 25 April 2017 during a bandh called in support of farmers. Protesters were arrested by the police.
DMK staged a protest in Tiruchirappalli on 25 April 2017 in support of farmers. Protesters were arrested by the police.
People's march for the liberation of Dakar Mayor was blocked by policemen. The situation was tense but did not degenerate.

Police forces intervened to disperse peaceful protesters in Teborsouk using teargas. The demonstrators demanded the dismissal of the local delegate and his staff, and protested the poor development of the region.
A leader of the 'Concerned Nigerians' group is arrested during a protest for the release of a PDP on-line blogger.
A crowd of people protested about the construction that was ongoing on a disputed land. Police fired warning shots to disperse the crowd. There were no reports of casualties.
Police broke up a peaceful demonstration of the opposition Pakistan Tehreek-i-Insaf (PTI) in Muzaffarabad, resorting to baton charge and briefly detaining activists.
The traders staged a protest in front of the police station and demanded punishment to those who were caught. However, the police dispersed the protesters.

Investors of Pearl Group protested in Banur on Monday against the move to hand over the Gian Sagar Medical College and Hospital to a private firm. The police cane charged and detain around 250 protesters.

actor2: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) General Service Unit
notes: GSU officers disperse angry supporters of Nicholas Wanyepe who were on April 23, 2017 protesting at the ODM Kilifi officers after he lost the Kilifi South parliamentary ticket to businessman Ken Chonga

Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N), Pakistan Peoples Party (PPP), and Muttahida Qaumi Movement-Pakistan (MQM-P), staged separate protest rallies in Karachi concerning power load-shedding, water and gas shortages, and bad governence in general. However, police eventually had to disrupt the protests when members from the groups began to protest each other and threaten violence.

Dalit community members of Patrehri village in Ambala district tried to gherao the Chief Minister'Aos camp office on Sunday, demanding the release of four youths who were arrested in connection with the murder of a 70-year-old man in the village on March 13 and a fair probe into the matter. The protesters were however stopped by the police. They staged a dharna outside the camp office and later returned to Karan Park and continued with their protest there. Day 3
Police intervened to attempt to prevent a march for accessibility in Luanda. The protesters were prevented from displaying their posters.

The kin of a patient admitted to a private hospital blocked Batala Road in Amritsar on Saturday, alleging that the hospital staff had manhandled their family members. Police officials had to intervene to get the road cleared.

Protesting daily wage labourers allegedly disrupted the FCI'Aos work of loading wheat into railway wagons in Faridkot on Saturday. The police rounded up about 70 daily wagers. They have been protesting for the past week after the FCI allotted the work of wagon loading to a private contractor.

assoc_actor_1: SNCCOPEN: National Union of Common Bodies and Professional Workers in Public Education
notes: Police arrested demonstrators and members of the SNCCOPEN union in Mascara.
Anti-riot police disperse angry voters at Hola who were prevented from voting by the agents of a gubernatorial aspirant
A group of people were dispersed by the police and 14 were detained when they organized a protests against referendum results by the reason of holding protests illegally in Usak.

Dozens of Palestinians gathered at Beita crossroads south of Nablus to perform Friday prayers in solidarity with hunger strikers. One Palestinian teenager was detained from the Nablus district as Israeli forces attempted to prevent worshipers from performing Friday prayers there.
Dhanusha Police has arrested 13 cadres of the United Democratic Front (UDMF) on the charge of disrupting preparations of local level elections.
Police disperse crowds protesting the against the delayed polling material for the Jubilee primaries.

The leader of 'Concerned Nigerians' and several others are arrested at Unity Fountain during a protest against the federal government's insistence of a secret trial for the Biafran group leader, Nnamdi Kanu.
In the city of Bethlehem, Israeli forces suppressed a solidarity march by firing tear gas at protesters, who marched from a sit-in tent outside the al-Azza refugee camp.
Police detained 15 of the people protesting in Corum against referendum results with the claimed reason of 'not agreeing with the legitimate results of referendum'.

In Puducherry, former BJP parliamentarian Tarun Vijay faced the ire of Pondicherry Central University students who protested against his remarks about South Indians. The university campus witnessed a string of clashes between protesting students and police when the latter tried to forcefully remove the protesters leading to a lathi charge. About eight students were injured and about 15 students were arrested and later released.

A protest march of Maharashtra farmers from Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis's Assembly constituency in Nagpur to Prime Minister Narendra Modi's native place Vadnagar was stopped by the Gujarat police in Tapi district at the state border on Thursday. As many as 114 farmers, including Independent MLA from Maharashtra's Achalpur Bachu Kadu, were detained and later forced to go back to their home state by the Gujarat police.
Security forces fired teargas shells to disperse students, who were protesting against police action in various educational institutes at Bomai in Sopore, Baramulla.
Protesters tried to force the entrance of the governorate of Kairouan and stage a sit-in. They were repulsed by the security forces.

A group of people demonstrated peacefully in Jowhar town against the arrest of a director of an NGO and the closure of the only hospital serving the community in the town. The man was later released by Hirshabelle authorities. Police opened fire to disperse the crowd. There were no reports of casualties.
Israeli forces dismantled a tent in support of the mass hunger strike in the Issawiya neighborhood of East Jerusalem firing sound bombs at demonstrators.
Israeli police officers interrupted a solidarity sit in held outside the ICRC headquarters in Sheikh Jarrah.
CPI leaders were arrested in Hyderabad during a protest on 19 April 2017 demanding housing sites for Dalits in Rajendra Nagar.

Gujjar Bakarwal Students Welfare Association led a protest demonstration against the authorities of Jammu University. A number of students blocked the main road in front of university main gate. Police had to use force to vacate the road, following which tribal students blocked the university main gate.

Police detained 10 of the people protesting in Antalya city against referendum results. The protest was announced to be unauthorized.
9 people have been detained in Gaziantep during Turkey Referendum protests after widespread irregularities & shady result.

Police intervened in the anti-election programmes organised by the Netra Bikram Chand-led Communist Party of Nepal in Butwal and Janakpur on Tuesday In Butwal. Security personnel disrupted the function organised at Traffic Chowk to protest the local elections set for May 14.
BJP staged a protest in Poolangudi on 18 April 2017 demanding the closure of Tasmac outlets. Protesters were arrested by the police.

IYC staged a protest in Ernakulam on 18 April 2017 against the deaths of patients at the Government Medical College. Protesters were arrested by police.
A protest was staged in Ramanthali on 18 April 2017 demanding the closure of a sewage treatment plant. Protesters were arrested by the police.
BJP staged a protest in Manapparai on 18 April 2017 demanding the closure of Tasmac outlets. Protesters were arrested by the police.
BJP staged protests in Tiruchirappalli on 18 April 2017 demanding the closure of Tasmac outlets. Protesters were arrested by the police.

notes: Four students sustained injuries in a police cane-charge after they and hundreds more blocked the Jammu-Srinagar National Highway in Banihal for seven hours following a standoff with CRPF.
About 50 protesters gathered in Luanda to call for free and fair elections. The police broke up the protest and arrested 7 people.

On Monday, the TRS government passed a bill to increase reservation for backward sections among Muslims and held protests in Telangana against it on Monday. In Warangal town, BJP leaders and workers gathered in large numbers near Ekasila Park and took out a protest march. Police stopped them near Nalkalagutta Circle and arrested leaders.

Around 50 people gathered at a protest site next to Wat Bejamabophit to call for a return to democracy and setting up a people's council to take part in the country's administration. A team of police along with army and city law enforcement officers intervened to disperse the demonstration, forcefully removing some protesters.

The police lathi-charged protesting primary teachers when the latter tried to enter the local residence of Education Minister Ram Bilas Sharma at Satnali Chowk in Mahendragarh on Sunday. Some of the protesters who were demanding joining letters from the government suffered minor injuries. Earlier, hundreds of selected primary teachers from various districts of the state gathered at HUDA Park in Mahendragarh to protest against the state government for not accepting their demand.

Four students protesting rules in place a teacher training college were arrested in front of the Department of Higher Education in Mandalay. During the protest, the students held signs urging the college to respect students' freedom and human rights, practice democracy, and stop oppressing students.
Persistent mass protests have been reported throughout the week by the students in Niamey.

Hindu frontal organizations staged a demonstration at the premises of Akhileshwar Mahadeo temple in Teliarganj locality where a calf's head had been found earlier on Saturday morning, demanding arrest of the accused. Assuring arrest of the accused within 24 hours, the police dispersed the protesters.

Police foiled a protest march by Awami Itihad Party (AIP) to Badami Bagh cantonment in Srinagar and detained its chairman and MLA Engineer Rasheed. The protest march was against the recent killings of protesters, and other human rights violations by security forces in Valley.

Israeli forces used rubber batons, tear gas canisters and stun grenades to disperse a protest calling for the release of the bodies of Palestinians held by Israeli forces. A Palestinian Friday was shot and injured with a rubber coated-steel bullet.
In the village of Kafr Qaddum in the northernWest Bankdistrict of Qalqiliya, Israeli forces injured three Palestinian children with rubber-coated steel bullets during a demonstration.

During a weekly march in the village of Nilin in the centralWest Bankdistrict of Ramallah, Israeli forces shot Muhammad Abed al-Qader Omera with live ammunition, causing him to sustaininjuries,before detaining him and transferring him to an unknown location.

assoc_actor_1: UGET: General Union of Tunisian Students
notes: Police dispersed a student demonstration in Sfax using rubber bullets and teargas. Nobody was seriously injured.

Parents of students studying in private schools, led by Bahujan Samaj Party leader Satyapal Chaudhary, held a protest at the district headquarters in Ghaziabad against the sudden fee hike and submitted a memorandum to the District Magistrate (DM). During the protest, police stopped parents from entering the DM's chamber which lead to a scuffle. After about half an hour, DM Nidhi Kesarwani asked the police to allow a five-member delegation.
Pro-Tamil activists staged a protest in Chennai on 13 April 2017 in support of protesting farmers. Protesters were arrested by the police.
The TASMAC Employees Union staged a protest in Tiruchirappalli on 13 April 2017 demanding alternative government jobs due to closure of their liquor outlets. Protesters were arrested by the police.
Marking the three year anniversary of the Chibok abduction, Bring Back our Girls protesters attempt to enter the government house at Alausa before being dispersed by police

assoc_actor_1: UGET: General Union of Tunisian Students
notes: Tunisian students marched on Thursday in central Tunis to protest a proposed bill restricting access to the magistrature and the use of violence against protesting students on Tuesday. Police dispersed the sit-in injuring eight students not seriously.

Yemeni security forces protested unpaid wages in southern Yemen. Yemeni veterans demonstrated in Aden city by blocking off a major road until security forces broke up the protest.
People staged a protest near the Pakistan High Commission in New Delhi on Tuesday, against Pakistan and the decision to hand out the death sentence to Indian spy Kulbhushan Jadhav.
35 people were arrested on 11 April 2017 while protesting against a Tasmac outlet in Aravakurichi.
PMK activists were arrested on 11 April 2017 while protesting against a Tasmac outlet in Velayuthampalayam.

assoc_actor_1: SDPI: Social Democratic Party of India

12 activists of the Iyina movement were arrested as they prepared to demonstrate at the Labour Exchange in N'Djamena over alleged mismanagement by the government. They were later released.

Members of the Panjab University Campus Students Council (PUCSC) on Monday marched Student Centre to the Governor House on Panjab University campus to hand over a memorandum of their demands for rollback of the fee hike. The protesters were stopped near gate number one and 16 students were taken into temporary preventive custody by the police.

notes: Police and security forces fired smoke shells and resorted to lathi-charge to disperse protestors at Gopalpora in Kashmir. The people were protesting against the arrest of some members of a local militant's family.

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

Employees of the Gambia Milling Corporation (GMC) staged a peaceful strike at the company's main gate in Banjul to protest the suspension of five colleagues involved in an earlier strike at the company over unfair treatment by the company's management. Police intervened to disperse the protesters.

assoc_actor_1: OCR: Rally of the Congolese Opposition
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

Former Gurdaspur SAD MLA GS Babbehali and his supporters on Sunday night held a protest at the civil hospital in Gurdaspur where a youth was treated who had been assaulted by Babbehali's son earlier. The situation developed volatile after Babbehali allegedly forced his way into the hospital ward. Congress workers too arrived at the hospital and forced the police to intervene.
MCP supporters gathered at the airport to welcome the party president, Chakwera, but the rally was broken up by the Riot Police.

Two Palestinians were injured by rubber-coated steel bullets, while seven others suffered from severe tear gas inhalation on Friday as Israeli forces suppressed a weekly march in the village of Kafr Qaddum.

On 07 April 2017, in Kratie province, villagers in O'Krieng commune's O'Kandie village prevented soldiers from building a fence around disputed land that the army plans to use as training ground. Ten soldiers arrived to build the fence but were stopped by at least one villager standing in front of their tractor.

Police attacked and dispersed lawyers who started a "justice shift" in solidarity with the jailed journalists in Istanbul Courthouse in the Sisli area.
Seven environmentalists were detained today for protesting the felling of trees on a stretch of NH31 in Jalpaiguri.

assoc_actor_1: SDPI: Social Democratic Party of India
notes: Police used water cannons against SDPI protesters in Thiruvananthapuram on 6 April 2017.

On April 6, in Chandigarh (Chandigarh), students from various city colleges including PGGCG-11, PGGC-11, GCG-42, PGGC-46 and GGDSD-32 boycotted classes and raised slogans against fee hike of Panjab University on Thursday morning. In girls' colleges, gates were closed and students were not allowed to move out. Three male students were taken in preventive custody by the police from outside PGGC-11.

notes: Family members and supporters of a detainee arrested for unknown reasons mid-February held a demonstration in front of the Ministry of Justice in Khartoum, demanding his release. NISS broke up the protest and asked protesters to delete photos of the protest from their phones.

actor2: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
notes: Leaders and supporters of the opposition umbrella National Consensus Forces (NCF) staged a protest in fron of NISS headquarters demanding the release of all political detainees. NISS agents dispersed the protest, arresting seven protesters, including three NCF leaders.

assoc_actor_1: NSUI: National Students' Union of India
notes: Hundreds of students staged to protest against fee hike by Punjab University at the Post Graduate Government College for Girls (PGGCG), Sector 11, and at Punjab University in Chandigarh on Wednesday. The protest that started from the PGGCG-11 in the morning spilled over to the Panjab University campus and lasted nearly six hours. Various student outfits, including ABVP, SFS, SOI and NSUI joined the protest. The police detained five protesters (four members of the SFS and a student of PGGC-11) but had to release them later to pacify the protesting students.

Students and faculty members of Gian Sagar Medical College and Hospital, Banur, protest at the Sector 10 and 17 roundabout in Chandigarh on Wednesday, against the college management and Punjab government for non-payment of salaries. The police rounded up the protesting students at Matka Chowk.
On 04-April-2017, in Naypyidaw, protesters from Bago marching over dissatisfaction with the lack of rule of law in the country were blocked by police from protesting at the Supreme Court office.

Locals and businessmen from Chabahil in Kathmandu on Monday protested against the slow paced work being done by Melamchi Drinking Water Project staffers that has led to unbearable dusty conditions in the area. Police resorted to baton charge. Some demonstrators survived minor injuries in the scuffle.

Agra witnessed massive protest mostly by women against the relocation of liquor shops to residential areas following a Supreme Court order banning the sale of liquor within 500 metres of national and state highways. On Monday, local residents, mostly women, staged protest and resorted to sabotage liquor shops to press their demand for complete shut down or shifting elsewhere considerable distance from residential areas in Lohamandi, Bodla, Namner, Bhogipura, Idgah, Dhandhopura, Gautamnagar and other places. Police arrested close to 20 persons mostly women for disturbing the peace in Agra. Day 3

actor2: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
notes: Factions of the APC clash outside the state secretariat in Ibadan. The violence stemmed from a disagreement over an appointment in Akinyele Local Government Area of the state. Injury extent not known. Attempting to protest earlier in the day, one of the factions was stopped by the NURTW at Moniya. It was gathered that the NURTW members allegedly acted on the orders of state chairman, Alhaji Taofeek Oyerinde (Fele), to prevent them from holding their protest.
A protest was staged in front of the Election Commission Office at Kantipath on Sunday. Police have detained Naya Shakti Party Nepal Coordinator Baburam Bhattarai among other leaders.

Police used water cannons and batons on protesting workers of civil society, led by Alamgir Khan of FixIt, outside Karachi Press Club, before arresting dozens of them. They were marching towards the Chief Minister House in Red Zone against infrastructure issues in the city.

JCD and BNP activists brought out processions at Kazir Dewri in front of the party office and the adjacent Station Road area. As they tried to block Jubilee Road for a street rally, the on-duty policemen thwarted them.

Around 1,000 parents of students of various schools took part in an protest rally in Gurgaon on Sunday, demanding a rollback of the fee hike by various private schools in the city. The police allegedly resorted to lathi charge to disperse the protesters. Some of them received minor injuries.

BJP activists staged a protest and raised slogans at Oakover in Shimla on Sunday, seeking the resignation of Chief Minister Virbhadra Singh on moral grounds after filing of a charge sheet by the CBI in disproportionate assets (DA) case. The BJP workers tried to gate-crash into the residence of the Chief Minister but were stopped by the police.
A film director and 20 others were arrested during a protest in Chennai on 2 April 2017 in support of farmers of fast in New Delhi.
Students staged a protest in Chennai on 1 April 2017 in support of farmers fasting in New Delhi. Protesters were arrested by the police.
